sentences: The UN Climate Change Conference in Copenhagen, Denmark, took place in December 2009.
The high-profile event was marked by disputes over transparency and process.
During the high-level segment, informal negotiations took place in a group consisting of major economies and representatives of regional and other negotiating groups.
Late in the evening of 18 December, these talks resulted in a political agreement, the 'Copenhagen Accord', which was then presented to the COP plenary for adoption.
After 13 hours of debate, delegates ultimately agreed to 'take note' of the Copenhagen Accord.
In 2010, over 140 countries indicated support for the Accord.
More than 80 countries provided information on their national mitigation targets or actions.
Parties also agreed to extend the mandates of the AWG-LCA and AWG-KP to 2010.
